meanings.definition: The quality of being easily maintained or preserved.
meanings.sent1: The maintainability of the garden was evident in how quickly the flowers grew back after pruning.
meanings.sent2: Regular oil changes are essential for the maintainability of a car's engine.
meanings.sent3: The maintainability of the old clock was so impressive that it seemed to fix itself!
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude towards life's challenges was the key to her maintainability through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The maintainability of the ancient ruins was a testament to the craftsmanship of the builders.

meanings.definition: The ability to be kept in good condition or repair.
meanings.sent1: The maintainability of the road was evident in the smoothness of the ride.
meanings.sent2: Regular maintenance checks ensure the maintainability of the machinery.
meanings.sent3: The maintainability of the leaky faucet was a constant source of frustration for the homeowner.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to exercise and healthy eating contributed to the maintainability of his physical fitness.
meanings.sent5: The maintainability of the historic building was a top priority for the preservation society.
